text: STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURE (SOP) Patient Admission Process 1. Document Control Document Title: Patient Admission SOP Document Number: HOSP-ADM-SOP-001 Department: Administration / Nursing Version: 1.0 Effective Date: __________ Review Date: __________ Prepared By: ____________________ Reviewed By: ____________________ Approved By: ____________________ 2. Purpose To establish a standardized procedure for safe, efficient, and compliant patient admission into the hospital to ensure proper documentation, identification, and allocation of care. 3. Scope This SOP applies to: Front Office / Reception Admission Desk Nursing Department Billing Department Duty Medical Officer Ward Staff It covers all elective, emergency, and transfer admissions. 4. Definitions Admission: Formal acceptance of a patient into the hospital for medical care. MRD: Medical Records Department. IPD: In-Patient Department. Triage: Process of prioritizing patients based on clinical urgency. 5. Responsibilities 5.1. Front

ient into the hospital for medical care. MRD: Medical Records Department. IPD: In-Patient Department. Triage: Process of prioritizing patients based on clinical urgency. 5. Responsibilities 5.1. Front Desk Staff Register patient details. Verify identity proof. Generate UHID (Unique Hospital Identification Number). Inform billing and ward staff. 5.2. Nursing Staff Prepare assigned bed. Verify patient identity. Record baseline vitals. Initiate nursing assessment. 5.3. Duty Medical Officer Perform initial clinical evaluation. Confirm admission order. Document diagnosis and treatment plan. 5.4. Billing Department Provide cost estimate. Collect advance payment (if applicable). Issue receipt and admission confirmation. 6. Procedure 6.1. Elective Admission Patient reports to admission desk with referral/admission advice. Identity verification performed. Registration form completed. UHID generated. Advance deposit collected. Bed assigned based on availability. Admission slip generated. Patient

eferral/admission advice. Identity verification performed. Registration form completed. UHID generated. Advance deposit collected. Bed assigned based on availability. Admission slip generated. Patient escorted to allocated ward/room. Nursing staff completes admission assessment. Medical officer reviews and writes initial orders. 6.2. Emergency Admission Patient received in Emergency Department. Triage assessment conducted immediately. Emergency stabilization initiated. Registration completed after stabilization. Inform relatives regarding admission status. Transfer to appropriate ward/ICU after medical clearance. 6.3. Transfer Admission (Internal/External) Transfer note reviewed. Bed availability confirmed. Clinical handover documented. Admission documentation completed. Patient reassessed upon arrival. 7. Documentation Required Admission Form Consent Form ID Proof Copy Insurance Documents (if applicable) Initial Assessment Notes Advance Payment Receipt All records must be submitted to

upon arrival. 7. Documentation Required Admission Form Consent Form ID Proof Copy Insurance Documents (if applicable) Initial Assessment Notes Advance Payment Receipt All records must be submitted to MRD within 24 hours. 8. Infection Control Measures Hand hygiene compliance. Use of PPE where required. Isolation protocol for infectious cases. Proper linen and bed sanitization before occupancy. 9. Safety Measures Confirm patient identity using two identifiers. Fall risk assessment on admission. Allergy status documentation. Medication reconciliation. 10. Quality Indicators Admission processing time. Documentation completeness rate. Patient satisfaction score. Bed allocation turnaround time. 11. Incident Handling Any of the following must be reported: Wrong patient admission Identity mismatch Billing error Delay causing clinical risk Incident report must be submitted within 24 hours to Quality Department. 12. Compliance This SOP complies with: Hospital accreditation standards Clinical go

h Billing error Delay causing clinical risk Incident report must be submitted within 24 hours to Quality Department. 12. Compliance This SOP complies with: Hospital accreditation standards Clinical governance policies Health information privacy regulations Non-compliance may result in disciplinary action. 13. Review & Revision This SOP shall be reviewed annually or earlier if: Regulatory changes occur Process changes are implemented Audit findings require revision 14. fever disease are handled by doctors who have less experience To establish a standardized clinical approach for assessment, diagnosis, management, and monitoring of patients presenting with fever in order to ensure patient safety, early diagnosis, and appropriate treatment. Fever Ward Details Ward Name: Fever Ward Ward Number: 12 Floor: 2nd Floor Bed Capacity: 25 Beds Isolation Rooms: 5 Nursing Station Contact: Ext. 245 Consultant In-Charge: Dr. shoyo Visiting Hours: 4:00 PM â￿￿ 6:00 PM Approval Hospital Administrator: __

: 12 Floor: 2nd Floor Bed Capacity: 25 Beds Isolation Rooms: 5 Nursing Station Contact: Ext. 245 Consultant In-Charge: Dr. shoyo Visiting Hours: 4:00 PM â￿￿ 6:00 PM Approval Hospital Administrator: ____________________ Signature: ____________________ Date: ____________________ Nursing Superintendent: ____________________ Signature: ____________________ Date: ____________________

Purpose To establish a standardized procedure for safe, efficient, and compliant patient admission into the hospital to ensure proper documentation, identification, and allocation of care. 3. Scope This SOP applies to: Front Office / Reception Admission Desk Nursing Department Billing Department Duty Medical Officer Ward Staff It covers all elective, emergency, and transfer admissions. 4. Definitions Admission: Formal acceptance of a patient into the hospital for medical care. MRD: Medical Records Department. IPD: In-Patient Department. Triage: Process of prioritizing patients based on clinical urgency. 5. Responsibilities 5.1. Front

ient into the hospital for medical care. MRD: Medical Records Department. IPD: In-Patient Department. Triage: Process of prioritizing patients based on clinical urgency. 5. Responsibilities 5.1. Front Desk Staff Register patient details. Verify identity proof. Generate UHID (Unique Hospital Identification Number). Inform billing and ward staff. 5.2. Nursing Staff Prepare assigned bed. Verify patient identity. Record baseline vitals. Initiate nursing assessment. 5.3. Duty Medical Officer Perform initial clinical evaluation. Confirm admission order. Document diagnosis and treatment plan. 5.4. Billing Department Provide cost estimate. Collect advance payment (if applicable). Issue receipt and admission confirmation. 6. Procedure 6.1. Elective Admission Patient reports to admission desk with referral/admission advice. Identity verification performed. Registration form completed. UHID generated. Advance deposit collected. Bed assigned based on availability. Admission slip generated. Patient

eferral/admission advice. Identity verification performed. Registration form completed. UHID generated. Advance deposit collected. Bed assigned based on availability. Admission slip generated. Patient escorted to allocated ward/room. Nursing staff completes admission assessment. Medical officer reviews and writes initial orders. 6.2. Emergency Admission Patient received in Emergency Department. Triage assessment conducted immediately. Emergency stabilization initiated. Registration completed after stabilization. Inform relatives regarding admission status. Transfer to appropriate ward/ICU after medical clearance. 6.3. Transfer Admission (Internal/External) Transfer note reviewed. Bed availability confirmed. Clinical handover documented. Admission documentation completed. Patient reassessed upon arrival. 7. Documentation Required Admission Form Consent Form ID Proof Copy Insurance Documents (if applicable) Initial Assessment Notes Advance Payment Receipt All records must be submitted to

upon arrival. 7. Documentation Required Admission Form Consent Form ID Proof Copy Insurance Documents (if applicable) Initial Assessment Notes Advance Payment Receipt All records must be submitted to MRD within 24 hours. 8. Infection Control Measures Hand hygiene compliance. Use of PPE where required. Isolation protocol for infectious cases. Proper linen and bed sanitization before occupancy. 9. Safety Measures Confirm patient identity using two identifiers. Fall risk assessment on admission. Allergy status documentation. Medication reconciliation. 10. Quality Indicators Admission processing time. Documentation completeness rate. Patient satisfaction score. Bed allocation turnaround time. 11. Incident Handling Any of the following must be reported: Wrong patient admission Identity mismatch Billing error Delay causing clinical risk Incident report must be submitted within 24 hours to Quality Department. 12. Compliance This SOP complies with: Hospital accreditation standards Clinical go

h Billing error Delay causing clinical risk Incident report must be submitted within 24 hours to Quality Department. 12. Compliance This SOP complies with: Hospital accreditation standards Clinical governance policies Health information privacy regulations Non-compliance may result in disciplinary action. 13. Review & Revision This SOP shall be reviewed annually or earlier if: Regulatory changes occur Process changes are implemented Audit findings require revision 14. fever disease are handled by doctors who have less experience To establish a standardized clinical approach for assessment, diagnosis, management, and monitoring of patients presenting with fever in order to ensure patient safety, early diagnosis, and appropriate treatment.
